summary: This document is a chain of emails from June-July 2019 between FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel coordinating victim notification procedures in anticipation of Jeffrey Epstein's arrest. It discusses compiling a list of 31 identified victims, challenges with contact information, and the urgency of preparing the Victim Notification System (VNS).

events.title: Preparation for Epstein's arrest and victim notification
events.description: Emphasizes the imperative to have all victim information ready in the Victim Notification System (VNS) for when charges are filed and an arrest is announced, including setting up an 800 number for victims.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office â€” SDNY, 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) were actively coordinating victim notification procedures in late June 2019, anticipating Jeffrey Epstein's arrest.
A list of 31 identified victims existed, but most lacked contact information, and some had declined interviews or were advised by attorneys not to discuss the case.
The urgency stressed was to have all victim information entered into the Victim Notification System (VNS) so victims could be notified of their rights immediately upon arrest and charging.
The plan included a press release and an 800 number for victims to self-identify after the arrest.
Email correspondents' names are partially redacted, but the chain shows coordination between FBI Victim Services and the SDNY.
